[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Integration] [Error Recovery] When native functions return errors, does the VM properly clean up resources (file handles, network connections, memory allocations) or can error returns cause resource leaks? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Function: LimitExceededError::from_err()] [StatusCode Exhaustiveness] Does the match statement cover all possible StatusCode variants, or can new status codes be added upstream that fall through to InvariantViolation incorrectly? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Function: LimitExceededError::from_err()] [Status Code Replay] Can an attacker capture a LimitExceeded error from one transaction and replay it in another context to bypass gas checks in the second transaction? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Function: LimitExceededError::from_err()] [Status Code Priority] When multiple limits are exceeded simultaneously (e.g., both gas and memory), does from_err() handle priority correctly, or can lower-priority errors mask critical failures? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Struct: MeteringError] [Memory Leak] When MeteringError is created but never unpacked, does the inner PartialVMError get properly dropped, or can repeated error creation cause memory leaks? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError] [Large Error Variants] Do the FunctionDispatch and LoadModule variants with complex fields (Vec, SmallVec, ModuleId) cause excessive stack usage when SafeNativeError is returned, potentially causing stack overflow? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Value Ownership] When args are moved into FunctionDispatch, does the dispatched function properly take ownership, or can dangling references or use-after-move bugs occur? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError] [Drop Implementation] Are there custom Drop implementations for SafeNativeError variants that could fail or panic, causing transaction processing to abort unexpectedly? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [All] [Thread Safety] Are SafeNativeError and its variants Send + Sync, and if so, can concurrent error creation/handling cause data races in multi-threaded execution contexts? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Function: MeteringError::unpack()] [Concurrent Unpack] Can multiple threads call unpack() on the same MeteringError instance concurrently, causing undefined behavior or memory corruption? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Concurrent Dispatch] Can FunctionDispatch be invoked concurrently from multiple threads targeting the same module, causing race conditions in module loading or function resolution? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Type System Bypass] Can manipulated Type arguments in ty_args violate Move's resource safety guarantees, allowing double-spending or resource duplication? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Generic Type Instantiation] When dispatching to generic functions, does type instantiation properly validate constraints, or can invalid type parameters bypass type safety checks? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Value Representation] Are Value representations in args validated for consistency with Move's value model, or can malformed values cause VM crashes? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::Abort] [Zero Abort Code] Is abort_code = 0 a valid abort code, or could it be confused with success/no-error states in error handling logic? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Empty Arguments] Can FunctionDispatch be created with empty ty_args and args vectors to dispatch to zero-parameter functions, and is this handled correctly? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::FunctionDispatch] [Maximum Arguments] Is there a maximum limit on the number of arguments in FunctionDispatch, or can extremely large argument lists cause memory exhaustion? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Function: LimitExceededError::from_err()] [Null PartialVMError] Can from_err() receive a null or uninitialized PartialVMError, causing undefined behavior when calling major_status()? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::LimitExceeded] [Gas Refund Manipulation] When LimitExceeded is returned, does the gas refund calculation properly account for work already done, or can partial execution consume resources without paying? (High)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::LoadModule] [Module Loading Cost] Is the gas cost for LoadModule consistent regardless of module size and complexity, or can large modules be loaded at fixed cost, creating economic imbalance? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Function: LimitExceededError::from_err()] [Execution Limit Gaming] Can an attacker craft transactions that repeatedly approach EXECUTION_LIMIT_REACHED without exceeding it, performing computation while minimizing gas costs? (Medium)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError::InvariantViolation] [Internal State Leakage] Does the PartialVMError in InvariantViolation expose internal VM state or memory addresses that could aid in crafting exploits? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError] [Error Message Injection] Can user-controlled data appear in error messages in ways that could facilitate log injection or confuse monitoring systems? (Low)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Function: LimitExceededError::from_err()] [Non-Deterministic Error Classification] Is the StatusCode matching in from_err() deterministic across all validator nodes, or can platform/configuration differences cause divergent error classifications? (Critical)

[File: aptos-core/aptos-move/aptos-native-interface/src/errors.rs] [Enum: SafeNativeError] [Error Enum Ordering] If SafeNativeError variant ordering or discriminant values differ between nodes (due to compiler differences), could this cause consensus failures? (Critical)
